channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Ex-lecturer who shot upskirt videos of a female student sentenced to 8 weeks' jail
item.description:
August 21, 2020 2:49 PM

SINGAPORE - A former lecturer of a post-secondary institution who shot upskirt videos of a female student was sentenced on Friday (Aug 21) to eight weeks imprisonment.

item.title: 89 BTO projects have resumed works; only 1 site pending approval: HDB
item.description:
August 21, 2020 2:47 PM

SINGAPORE - Construction works have resumed at a total of 89 Build-To-Order (BTO) sites from Monday, said Minister for National Development Desmond Lee on Friday (Aug 21).

item.title: E-scooter rider jailed 6 weeks for hitting pedestrian with unregistered device, causing fractured skull
item.description:
August 21, 2020 2:46 PM

SINGAPORE - A man rode an unregistered e-scooter against the flow of traffic along Selegie Road last October and struck a pedestrian, causing her to suffer from a fractured skull.

item.title: Tangs allows all front-line staff, including contractors, to wear religious headgear from Friday
item.description:
August 21, 2020 1:50 PM

SINGAPORE - All customer-facing staff at Tangs can don religious headgear while at work from Friday (Aug 21), if they choose to do so.

item.title: SkillsFuture@CDC virtual event to help job seekers in skills training extended to September
item.description:
August 21, 2020 1:24 PM

SINGAPORE - A virtual event offering career workshops and a guide to resources for skills training will be extended till September following a run last week that attracted more than 257,000 participants.

item.title: Only 4 per cent of Singaporeans able to identify all phishing e-mails correctly: CSA survey
item.description:
August 21, 2020 1:01 PM

Only about 40 among 1,000 respondents correctly identified all eight e-mails given by the survey, six of which were phishing e-mails.

item.title: 21 months' jail for woman who abused maid, husband given 4 months
item.description:
August 21, 2020 11:31 AM

SINGAPORE - A woman who repeatedly abused her domestic helper from her first day of work was sentenced on Friday (Aug 21) to 21 months imprisonment.

item.title: Singapore researchers discover new Covid-19 variant which causes milder infections
item.description:
August 21, 2020 10:45 AM

This could provide new avenues for vaccine and therapeutic development, experts say.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on Aug 21
item.description:
August 21, 2020 7:45 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Friday, Aug 21.

item.title: Nearly 6 in 10 satisfied with Govt's handling of pandemic: Poll
item.description:
August 21, 2020 5:00 AM

A recent survey on workplace resilience has found that close to six in 10 Singaporeans were satisfied with how the Government managed the Covid-19 situation, though they may feel stressed by the pandemic.

item.title: Haidilao's billionaire couple top Forbes list of Singapore's richest
item.description:
August 21, 2020 5:00 AM

The Covid-19 pandemic has not blunted the wealth of Singapore's richest, even as it propelled some ahead of others.

item.title: Tan Chuan-Jin to be nominated again for Speaker
item.description:
August 21, 2020 5:00 AM

Mr Tan Chuan-Jin will be nominated for re-election as Speaker of Parliament when the House meets next Monday.

item.title: Man convicted of culpable homicide for stabbing son-in-law
item.description:
August 21, 2020 5:00 AM

Unhappy with how his son-in-law had treated his daughter and believing that it was part of a plan to cheat him of his business, a semi-retired businessman repeatedly stabbed the younger man in front of a lunchtime crowd.

item.title: Google services suffer global outage
item.description:
August 21, 2020 5:00 AM

Google suffered a seven-hour global outage yesterday that affected many of its services, including e-mail, storage, documents and videoconferencing.

item.title: SMC panel explains why interim orders needed against two doctors
item.description:
August 21, 2020 5:00 AM

Public confidence in the medical profession would have been dampened if no restrictions were placed on two doctors accused by a woman of taking advantage of vulnerable patients for sex, the Singapore Medical Council (SMC) said.

item.title: Jobs offered by start-ups include chefs, engineers
item.description:
August 21, 2020 5:00 AM

The top five jobs most commonly offered by start-ups as part of the SGUnited Jobs and Skills programmes are software developers, chefs, engineers, sales, marketing and business development managers, and administrative and related associate professionals, said the Ministry of Manpower yesterday in its weekly jobs situation report.

item.title: Drones join NEA battle against dengue
item.description:
August 21, 2020 5:00 AM

A drone piloted by the National Environment Agency (NEA) inspected roof gutters in Eng Kong estate for potential dengue breeding spots yesterday morning.

item.title: 224,800 workers affected by cost-cutting measures
item.description:
August 21, 2020 5:00 AM

About 6,300 employers have submitted notifications to the Ministry of Manpower (MOM) on their cost-cutting measures between March and July, which affected about 224,800 local and foreign employees.

item.title: 28 years' jail, caning for man who raped daughter
item.description:
August 21, 2020 5:00 AM

A 48-year-old man, who raped his biological daughter when she was around seven to eight years old and continued sexually abusing her for about seven years, was sentenced to 28 years' jail and 24 strokes of the cane yesterday.

item.title: Let go at 60, she finds new role in start-up
item.description:
August 21, 2020 5:00 AM

One Sunday last December, Madam Becky Chang, 60, had a feeling she was about to lose her job in a shipping company.

item.title: No place for discrimination in Singapore: Halimah
item.description:
August 21, 2020 5:00 AM

President Halimah Yacob has condemned in strong terms discrimination at the workplace, saying it is particularly disturbing during the Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Plans to bring more job fairs to the heartland
item.description:
August 21, 2020 5:00 AM

Plans to bring more job fairs to the heartland are in the works, even as the Covid-19 pandemic takes a toll on the labour market.

item.title: President advises families to seek help early
item.description:
August 21, 2020 5:00 AM

Despite the new challenges brought about by Covid-19, the future is not all doom and gloom, with support available for those requiring help. President Halimah Yacob shared this message, and her concerns for families with financial woes who are unaware of benefits and subsidies, during her visit to non-profit group AMP Singapore's office at Pasir Ris East Community Building yesterday.

item.title: SIA cabin crew members find new calling as patient care officers
item.description:
August 21, 2020 5:00 AM

Former Singapore Airlines (SIA) crew member Tristan Yap, 31, had been working in a temporary role as a care ambassador at Khoo Teck Puat Hospital (KTPH) for just a couple of weeks when he encountered a patient who was delirious after an accident.

item.title: Grandpa's police stories inspire Home Team Scholarship recipient
item.description:
August 21, 2020 5:00 AM

Mr Jared Koh, 20, grew up listening to his grandfather's police yarns, including his time as a beat cop in Singapore's founding years.

item.title: NCSS looks to hire up to 50 PMEs to manage volunteers
item.description:
August 21, 2020 5:00 AM

The National Council of Social Service (NCSS) is looking to hire up to 50 professionals, managers or executives (PMEs) from outside the social service sector to manage volunteers at charities here.

item.title: Beach hygiene tips issued after 4 suffer skin irritation on Sentosa
item.description:
August 21, 2020 5:00 AM

They were infected by staphylococcus aureus, a harmless and common bacterium.

item.title: Coronavirus: Out of 83k travellers entering S'pore from June 18 to Aug 6, 152 tested positive
item.description:
August 21, 2020 5:00 AM

Notably absent from the list of countries where recent cases were imported from was Malaysia.

item.title: SP Group, NTU tie up on $30m research, education initiatives
item.description:
August 21, 2020 5:00 AM

National power grid operator SP Group has set aside $20 million to launch a joint lab with Nanyang Technological University (NTU) and contributed $10 million towards setting up two endowment funds with the university.

item.title: 14,500 foreign workers serving quarantine
item.description:
August 21, 2020 5:00 AM

About 14,500 foreign workers are currently serving out their quarantine after testing of all workers in dormitories was completed on Aug 11.

item.title: Firm fined $52k for falsely declaring workers' salaries to MOM
item.description:
August 21, 2020 5:00 AM

To secure work passes for its foreign employees, a company inflated their monthly salaries in its applications to the Ministry of Manpower (MOM). This was to fulfil the minimum salary requirements for the work passes to be granted.

item.title: Four common gut problems that may affect your overall health
A rewarding career helping children with autism lead productive lives
item.description:
August 21, 2020 4:00 AM

Studying psychology has given JCU graduate Aishah Zaini the skills and confidence necessary to help her students with special needs
